Install with Composer

Run the following command:

$ composer require tompedals/jekyllscout

Configure Jekyll Scout

Create a new file .jekyllscout.yml in the root of your Jekyll project.

Enter your Help Scout API key and the site ID. The site ID can be found in the URL of your Site Settings page in Help Scout. It will look a little like the example below.

api_key: secret
site_id: 57e1a37c9033606c1955afc3

Configure your collections

Update your Jekyll _config.yml and add the following collections. This is how your Help Scout docs content will be made available to Jekyll.

collections:
  helpscout_collections:
    output: true
    permalink: /collection/:path/
  helpscout_categories:
    output: true
    permalink: /category/:path/
  helpscout_articles:
    output: true
    permalink: /article/:path/

Sync content

Run the following command to sync your Help Scout Docs content as Jekyll pages.

$ ./vendor/bin/jekyllscout sync .

This will create the relevant files within the configured collections directories. By default this will be _helpscout_articles, _helpscout_categories and _helpscout_collections.
